docs.snippet: The tedium of Tottenville, S.I., where, though it is a part of Greater New York, the morning newspapers sell at 6 P.M., combined with the alluring prospects of a life in the glamour of the footlights, proved too much for two little girls who still...
docs.lead_paragraph: The tedium of Tottenville, S.I., where, though it is a part of Greater New York, the morning newspapers sell at 6 P.M., combined with the alluring prospects of a life in the glamour of the footlights, proved too much for two little girls who still wear short skirts.

headline.main: LURE OF A STAGE LIFE HITS TOTTENVILLE, S.I.; And Two Little Girls Run Away to a Hypnotist's Troupe. IT CERTAINLY IS DULL THERE But the Police Alarm Cover the Place and the Wandering Youngsters Are Back at Home.

docs.snippet: WE give up a fair share of valuable space this week, as a matter of news, to an exposition of Dr. Oscar Levy's curious and audacious book called "The Revival of Aristocracy," which has just been translated from the German and published in England. It...
docs.lead_paragraph: WE give up a fair share of valuable space this week, as a matter of news, to an exposition of Dr. Oscar Levy's curious and audacious book called "The Revival of Aristocracy," which has just been translated from the German and published in England. It is a book that will amaze many folks and set them talking.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 28. -- A monograph has been issued by the Bureau of Statistics describing the commerce between the United States and the countries south of us, and in which a table is given showing the value of the merchandise exchanged, as well as...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 28. -- A monograph has been issued by the Bureau of Statistics describing the commerce between the United States and the countries south of us, and in which a table is given showing the value of the merchandise exchanged, as well as the aggregate of the exports and imports of the several countries.

headline.main: TRADE WITH SOUTH AMERICA.; Imports and Exports To and From the United States.

headline.main: WORLD'S WIRELESS STATIONS; United States Heads With Eighty-eight, Navy Having Thirty-two.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Aug. 10. -- Secretary Root arrived here to-day on the cruiser Charleston.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Aug. 10. -- Secretary Root arrived here to-day on the cruiser Charleston.

headline.main: MONTEVIDEO WELCOMES ROOT; A Most Enthusiastic Demonstration -- Cheers for Roosevelt.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Aug. 11. -- The entertainments provided to-day for Mr. Root, the United States Secretary of State, were regal in character. They included an automobile excursion, a visit to the famous breeding studs, a reception by the municipality, a...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Aug. 11. -- The entertainments provided to-day for Mr. Root, the United States Secretary of State, were regal in character. They included an automobile excursion, a visit to the famous breeding studs, a reception by the municipality, a banquet given by President Ordonez, a gala performance at the theatre, and a pyrotechnic display.

headline.main: WE TRY EXPERIMENTS FOR EUROPE, SAYS ROOT; Reflex Action Felt in Every Country of the Old World. ALL AMERICA PROGRESSING Secretary's Speech at a Dinner Given by the President of Uruguay -- Enthusiasm Over His Visit.
ORDONEZ EMBRACES ROOT.; American Secretary Leaves Montevideo for Buenos Ayres.

docs.snippet: WHEN Secretary Root arrived in Buenos Ayres last week be became the guest of one of the most beautiful and progressive capitals of the world, the metropolis of the Southern Hemisphere, the largest city south of the equator, and the second Latin...
docs.lead_paragraph: WHEN Secretary Root arrived in Buenos Ayres last week be became the guest of one of the most beautiful and progressive capitals of the world, the metropolis of the Southern Hemisphere, the largest city south of the equator, and the second Latin municipality of the world.
docs.abstract: Illus of a public school bldg, City Hall and a private residence

headline.main: BUENOS AYRES: THE PARIS OF AMERICA; A City with "the Beauty of Washington, the Wealth of New York, and the Hustle of Chicago." Wonders of the South American Metropolis in Which Secretary Root Is Now Being Entertained -- An Opera House That Cost $10,000,000, and a Club Building That Cost $2,000,000. With a Population of 1,100,000 It Is Growing More Rapidly Than Any American City Except New York and Chicago -- A Great Shipping and Railroad Centre -- Soon to Have a Subway System.

byline.original: By JOHN BARRETT, Formerly U.S. Minister to Argentina
